node.title: Are bosses liable for compo if you catch COVID-19 at work?
node.alt: Pedestrians in a outdoor shopping mall
node.description: Businesses could face workers' compensation claims from staff if they can prove they caught COVID-19 in the workplace, lawyers say.
node.content:
["Businesses could face workers' compensation claims\u00a0if\u00a0staff can prove their employers failed to protect them from catching COVID-19 at work.\u00a0", "But legal experts warn that it is not yet clear how far Queensland businesses would need to go to demonstrate they took adequate precautions to keep their staff safe.", "Since the pandemic began, the state has accepted 25 workers' compensation claims from people with a confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis.", "A further 55 claims, which did not involve a COVID-19 diagnosis, were rejected.", "National Safe Work Australia figures show that 1,222 people made workers' compensation claims relating to COVID-19 last year. Of these,\u00a0127 were rejected.", "Among the 974 COVID-related\u00a0compensation claims that were accepted, 212 were for \"mental health impacts related to the virus\".", "Queensland kept its COVID cases low throughout\u00a02021, suppressing small outbreaks and avoiding the larger-scale clusters experienced in New South Wales and Victoria.", "", "
Queensland workers could lodge compensation claims if they are unable to work as a result of contracting COVID-19 in their workplace.(Unsplash: Sharon McCutcheon)
", "But that is likely to change as the state prepares to ease border restrictions next month\u00a0when it is expected to reach\u00a0an 80 per cent\u00a0COVID-19 vaccination target.\u00a0", "In data released this week, Outback Queensland, Central Queensland, Mackay and Logan all had double-vaccination rates below 70 per cent, the lowest in the state.", "Outside Brisbane, the Sunshine Coast and Toowoomba have the highest levels of vaccination with almost 90 per cent\u00a0of eligible people having had a single dose, and close to 80 per cent being fully vaccinated.", "
Proving 'negligence' not easy
", "Queenslanders will be entitled to workers' compensation through the state if they become infected with COVID while at work. But, they\u00a0will require medical evidence to show where and how they contracted the virus.", "Emma Crouch from Shine Lawyers said if a worker's claim was successful, WorkCover would pay lost wages and medical expenses rather than the employer.", "", "
Lawyer Emma Crouch.(Supplied: Shine Lawyers)
", "But if they believe their employer's negligence contributed to their catching COVID, they may sue through the courts.", "The legal and potential pay-outs would not be covered by the state system.", "\"If you're going to experience some lasting health complications and you're going to lose some time off work, there may be grounds to file a lawsuit,\" Ms Crouch\u00a0said.", "\"Not just that you caught it at work, but there was something that the employer could or should have done, which would have reduced that risk.\"", "
Do not ignore the risks: lawyers
", "Ms Crouch said there was no easy answer to what a boss or employer should be doing to protect themselves or their staff \u2014\u00a0but under the law, they should take \"reasonable steps\".", "The Queensland government has already mandated that those yet to be vaccinated will be barred from visiting or working in hospitals, cafes, pubs, clubs and theme parks, once the border rules ease.", "A spokesperson from the federal Attorney-General's office said that\u00a0while it considered\u00a0vaccines to be voluntary, businesses were obliged to try to keep workers, customers and visitors safe, or risk being in breach of the law.", "Ms Crouch advised businesses not to ignore the\u00a0risks.", "\"I don't think it's OK to say, 'We won't do anything'. Because that's not generally the case in workplaces,\" she said.", "\"There's a high duty owed to employees, to our workers, to our contractors.\"", "
Cases already reaching the courts
", "Ms Crouch said in one court case being heard in Victoria, a woman in a health facility had been\u00a0told by her bosses that she would have no contact with sick residents.", "Within two shifts, she fell ill, and is now living\u00a0with long-term effects of COVID, including brain fog\u00a0and respiratory issues, and is unable to exercise.", "", "
Professor Julie-Anne Tarr from Queensland University of Technology.(Supplied: QUT)
", "Queensland University of Technology professor Julie-Anne Tarr said if employers did\u00a0the right thing, they were likely to be able to protect themselves from legal risks.", "\"That would undermine any chance of a civil liability suit.\"", "
Will your work safety net be enough?
", "Professor Tarr said businesses would\u00a0have different insurance policies designed to protect employers and staff.", "But, she said, like any insurance policy, checking the fine\u00a0details was critical.", "Professor Tarr said most policies might cover \"business interruption\" issues that arose from a break-in or\u00a0power failure, but not necessarily from a once-in-a-lifetime pandemic.", "And some insurers might\u00a0even exclude the impacts of such a major outbreak.", "\"Or if it is to be included, it's pretty expensive.\"", "She said cases were already being run on whether or not insurers would cover pandemic-related costs, and they hinged on the exact wording of the policy.", "\"If that isn't enough to make you want to shoot down to your local lawyer, I don't know what is.\"", "", "
